intro: Ixora burundiensis, commonly known as the Burundi flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its vibrant orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and birds. Ixora burundiensis typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy texture, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
